oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Copy print of Confederate officer James J. Jackson
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Dressed in an officer's uniform, perhaps Confederate or pre-war militia, Jackson served in three wars: the 1836 Seminole campaign under William Trousdale, the War with Mexico, and the Civil War. He mustered into Co. G, 15th North Carolina Vol. Inf. and lived after the war in Maury County (Tenn." Several of his sons served in CSA forces during the war.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Jackson, James J.
